intro: Xiquexique frewenii, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Xiquexique frewenii is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
